noun.description: A person who takes someone or something in, in various senses.
Specifically. A person who carries out or is involved in an act of deception; a trickster, a swindler.
Stock Market. A broker who takes in stocks or shares. Compare "taker". Now disused.
In a carding machine: a cylinder which receives the cotton, wool, etc., from the feed rollers and passes it on to the main cylinder.

origin: Mid 17th century. From taker + in, after to take in.
